jparsec.math

Class Evaluation

  • java.lang.Object
    • jparsec.math.Evaluation
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class Evaluation
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    A class for evaluating functions into numbers. Functions should be expressed in the Java mathematical notation. This is the only class in JPARSEC that currently requires JRE 1.6 to be used.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    T. Alonso Albi - OAN (Spain)
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • evaluate

        public static double evaluate(java.lang.String function,
              java.lang.String[] variables)
                       throws JPARSECException
        Evaluates user's expression to it's numerical result (symbolic calculations), using javascript. Requires jre1.6.
        Parameters:
        function - The function.
        variables - The variables.
        Returns:
        The value of the function.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • evaluatePureJavaExpression

        public java.lang.Object evaluatePureJavaExpression(java.lang.String expression)
                                            throws JPARSECException
        Obtain result of an operation using Java scripting. The expression must be a pure Java representation of the operation to perform, no change is made to this input.
        Parameters:
        expression - Expression in Java format.
        Returns:
        Result of the operation.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • evaluateMathExpression

        public double evaluateMathExpression(java.lang.String expression,
                            java.lang.String[] variables)
                              throws JPARSECException
        Obtain result of an operation using Java scripting.
        Parameters:
        expression - Math expression in Java format.
        variables - Array of variables and values. Format is variable name, an space, and it's value.
        Returns:
        Result of the operation.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • resetVariable

        public void resetVariable(java.lang.String name,
                 double value)
        Resets the value of a given variable to another value in this instance. Later you can use evaluate() to evaluate an expression faster compared to creating the object again.
        Parameters:
        name - Variable name.
        value - New value.

      • resetVariables

        public void resetVariables(java.lang.String[] variables)
        Resets the values of the set of variables. Later you can use evaluate() to evaluate an expression faster compared to creating the object again.
        Parameters:
        variables - The variables.

      • evaluateMathFunction

        public double evaluateMathFunction(java.lang.String function,
                          double x,
                          double y,
                          double z)
                            throws JPARSECException
        Obtain result of a function using Java scripting. Function can be dependent of at most three variables, called x, y, and z.
        Parameters:
        function - Math function f(x, y, z) in Java format.
        x - Value of x.
        y - Value of y.
        z - Value of z.
        Returns:
        Result of the function.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • configureUserFunction

        public static java.lang.String configureUserFunction(java.lang.String f)
        Configures math operations and logical expressions to be able to evaluate them with Java Scripting. This method is only called by evaluate(), in the rest of cases it should be called explicitly.
        Parameters:
        f - Function.
        Returns:
        Same function, ready to evaluate.

      • interpolateFile

        public double interpolateFile(double interp_point,
                     java.lang.String dir)
                       throws JPARSECException
        This method reads a given file and interpolates the values. The function string should have tags like /file (file name), /separator (separator string), and /operation (operation expression).

        To refer to certain column in the file, the operation should have expressions like COLUMN18/COLUMN02 = column 18 divided by column 2. COLUMN in uppercase, and the number using two digits. The /operation tag should have two elements separated by two spaces: the operation expression for the x array of values, and the operation expression for the y array. x array should be radial distances in AU, while y array the corresponding value of the magnitude.

        Default separator (if it is not mencioned) in an space character. File path should be set starting from Core directory. The file can contain comments if the line starts with "!".

        This method can be applied to these functions: abundance, velocity, temperature, and density.

        Parameters:
        interp_point - Interpolation x point.
        dir - Main directory, root for /FILE tag.
        Returns:
        The adequate value.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - Thrown if the method fails.

      • evaluateFromFile

        public double evaluateFromFile(java.lang.String dir)
                        throws JPARSECException
        Evaluates a file and returns the operation desired.

        A /FILE tag is needed to set the input file from the working directory. Also A COLUMNxx (xx being the column number) is convenient. Math operations are allowed.

        Parameters:
        dir - URL of the working directory which serves as the root directory to get the file path.
        Returns:
        The adequate value.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - Thrown if the method fails.

      • evaluateFromFile

        public double evaluateFromFile(java.lang.String comment,
                      java.lang.String sep)
                        throws JPARSECException
        Evaluates a file and returns the operation desired.

        A /FILE tag is needed to set the input file from the working directory. Also A COLUMNxx (xx being the column number) is convenient. Math operations are allowed.

        Parameters:
        comment - Any line starting with any of the characters in this string will be skipped.
        sep - The separator for the different fields in the COLUMN tag.
        Returns:
        The adequate value.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - Thrown if the method fails.

      • getChart

        public CreateChart getChart(java.lang.String var,
                   double min,
                   double max,
                   int np)
                     throws JPARSECException
        Returns a chart showing the evaluated data.
        Parameters:
        var - The name of the variable to modify, for instance "x".
        min - Minimum value of the variable.
        max - Maximum value of the variable.
        np - Number of points.
        Returns:
        The chart.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.
